Hi everyone, I am trying to call <https://app.HubSpot.com/api/activities/v2/reports/all-pages-sources/total> and am getting the error:
```{'status': 'error', 'message': 'This oauth-token (pat-na1-c2f8d) does not have proper permissions! (requires any of [landingpages-analytics-api-access, provider-analytics-api-access, cms-analytics-api-access, traffic-analytics-api-access])', 'correlationId': '1e77b2da-3b08-45df-b35b-a62e8651aa02'}```
But I cannot find where I can set these permissions for the API-Token.
You set the scopes on the app in your HubSpot account.
the scopes mentioned in the errormessage do not seem to appear in the scopes list <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth>
am I missing something?
Can you try enabling the `business-intelligence` scope and test it again?

```Yes I need two different currencies because the transaction is linked to a customer account in England (pound) and a supplier in France (euro)```
``````
I tried to use deal owner as well, no luck there too
object type is 0-2
well to get associated company ids for a deal you would use this endpoint:
oh ok, so i pass my token too in the query now
ok let me try this

(This works for the current Private App method)

import requests
import csv

access_token = "your_access_token_here"
url = "<https://api.hubapi.com/properties/v1/companies/properties>"

headers = {"Authorization": f"Bearer {access_token}"}

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)

if response.status_code == 200:
    company_fields = response.json()
    field_names = [field["name"] for field in company_fields]
    with open("HubSpot_Company_Fields.csv", "w", newline="", encoding="utf-8") as file:
        writer = csv.writer(file)
        writer.writerow(["Field Name"])
        for field_name in field_names:
            writer.writerow([field_name])
    print("Company fields written to HubSpot_Company_Fields.csv.")
else:
    print("Failed to retrieve company fields. Status code:", response.status_code)

• this will print out just the field names - each on a separate row - into a csv in the directory you are running the script from.
• also assumes you are running python

Howdy all, I am just starting to use HubSpot-python-connector and have the following code:

```client = HubSpot.Client.create(access_token=os.getenv("HubSpot_TOKEN"), retry=retry)
deal_list = client.crm.deals.get_all(
    archived=False,
    properties=PROPERTIES,
    properties_with_history=["deal_stage"],
    limit=50,)```
Unfortunately, the objects returned have empty properties_with_history (`{}`) attributes. I'm struggling with where to tinker next to fix this... any suggestions?
FIXED: the correct property name is "dealstage" not "deal_stage"
Thank you! Is there a way to do this without the cooperation of the key holder/
no there isn't
you have to have someone give you a key with all the correct permissions
Thats what I figured. Is there any way to work around this other than having them be forced to disable that feature?
you could use the imports api to import data and associate it together but you would need to get your data in a csv format
I mean that wouldn't be impossible, albeit seems a bit unconventional if you end up having a thousand of those a day
Yeah definitely better just to create and associate
yes, I think if there is such a section, then it should be possible to connect to it
Not at this point, no. We can check for any volunteers here though when it's ready to test—but no timeline on when that will be

Hey <@U03D2AAMJP7> - the way that revenue attribution works in HubSpot is slightly different - you than described. You do not directly associate a Contact or a Deal with a Campaign (this is the way that Salesforce "thinks" about this idea - i.e. you create an association between these objects - the "Campaign Object and the "Campaign Member")

Instead, in HubSpot, Contacts become influenced by a Campaign based on the content they interact with. Then, if that Contact is associated to the Deal, then the Deal is said to have been attributed to the Campaign.

So, the most important thing is that you set your Deal Close Dates accurately, and that you associate your deals with contacts.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/reports/understand-attribution-reporting>
